newsitem.title: USA: Genset, Johnson & Johnson to collaborate.
newsitem.headline: Genset, Johnson & Johnson to collaborate.

text.p: Genset SA said it would collaborate with Johnson & Johnson in research to discover genes associated with schizophrenia.
The agreement between Janssen Pharmaceutica N.V., a wholly owned subsidiary of Johnson & Johnson, and Genset initially focuses on schizophrenia with an option to target a second disease.

Under the terms, Janssen Pharmaceutica N.V. would provide funding for research during a period of two years, and make additional payments as certain milestones are met. Janssen Pharmaceutica would pay royalties on net sales of all products developed with the genes discovered.
Johnson & Johnson Development made an equity investment of $4 million in Genset last May.
Genset is engaged in the systematic and comprehensive analysis of the human genome to identify and patent genes related to selected common diseases.
